Treatment of alcoholic hepatitis is mostly supportive treatment, vitamins and fluid replacement. At the same time, stopping alcohol is the most important care regimen. The goal of treating autoimmune hepatitis is to control the disease and reduce symptoms. At this time, corticosteroid drugs (such as prednisone or budesonide) and drugs that suppress the immune system (azathioprine, mycophenolate, tacrolimus, cyclosporine...) will be considered to slow down or prevent the immune system from becoming too active. levels, to prevent the body from attacking liver cells; The goal of treating autoimmune hepatitis is to control the disease and reduce symptoms.
